newsitem.title: THAILAND: RESEARCH ALERT - Nat Fertilizer rated "buy".
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Nat Fertilizer rated "buy".

text.p: Seamico Securities Plc on Wednesday rated National Fertilizer Corp a "buy" at 8.50 baht, saying Thailand's sole fertilizer producer has strong long-term fundamentals.
Seamico said National Fertilizer has potential to expand its one-million-tonne capacity plant at a relatively low cost after its delayed production start-up until October 1997.
"The stock should offer attractive returns in the longer term and it certainly deserves to be better rated," Seamico said.

Seamico said National Fertilizer became one of the worst performing new Thai stocks this year when it debuted on August 26. It closed its first trading day at 9.90 baht ($0.40) against a 16.00 baht initial public offering.
National Fertilizer finished on Wednesday at 7.90 baht.
Seamico said National Fertilizer will need to invest about three billion baht to expand its annual output capacity to two million tonnes from one million.
Its start-up plant, costing over six billion baht, will run at 80 percent of capacity in 1998, rising to 90 percent in 1999 and 100 percent in the year 2000.

National Fertilizer is expected to post a net operating loss in 1997, the first year of its domestic production, against a projected 50 million baht profit this year from sales of imported fertilizer.
